page.title: 05Exbourne 1900 - 1985
page.content: We interviewed some residents of Exbourne who had lived there for between sixty and eightyfive years. In 1900 the village was independant, with two butchers,bakers cobblers,a blacksmith,a thatcher and a well digger. Now there is only the combined Village stores and Post office. In 1900, most people worked in the village and there was a great community spirit.Concerts were held,the Churches were active. Little changed until after 1945. Telephones meant people no longer had to visit others. Cars have brought mobility,in work and entertainment. Tractors and machinery have cut jobs. In 1960 young people moved away to work,the village was dying. In 1980, new houses,too pricey for locals,have brought new families,mostly commuters. Community spirit is fast disappearing.
